definition: Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Buy gum in family-sized 10-packs so you're always prepared.
sentences.chinese: 買十包裝的家庭號口香糖，你就可以有備無患了。

sentences.english: No matter what the weather you will be prepared.
sentences.chinese: 無論天氣怎樣，你都有備無患。

sentences.english: All in all, being prepared ahead of time to prepare.
sentences.chinese: 總之是提前準備有備無患。

sentences.english: At this time, you should come to a "danger".
sentences.chinese: 這時，你應當來一個“有備無患”。

sentences.english: But it pays to plan ahead, just in case the politicians lose the last of their marbles.
sentences.chinese: 但是提前計劃有備無患，難說政客們不會拼死一搏。

sentences.english: The kitchen is met with electric equipment increasing, establish electrical outlet more switch precautions averts perils.
sentences.chinese: 廚房用電器會越來越多，多設插座開關有備無患。

sentences.english: Taurean people tend to be slow, methodical, practical, and reserved.
sentences.chinese: 他們做事緩慢，有條不紊，講究實際與有備無患。
